00073 
00086 class HTTPConnect {
00087 private:
00088     CURL *d_curl;
00089     RCReader *d_rcr;
00090     HTTPCache *d_http_cache;
00091 
00092     char d_error_buffer[CURL_ERROR_SIZE]; // A human-readable message.
00093 
00094     bool d_accept_deflate;
00095 
00096     string d_username;      // extracted from URL
00097     string d_password;      // extracted from URL
00098     string d_upstring;      // used to pass info into curl
00099 
00100     vector<string> d_request_headers; // Request headers
00101 
00102     void www_lib_init() throw(Error, InternalErr);
00103     long read_url(const string &url, FILE *stream, vector<string> *resp_hdrs,
00104           const vector<string> *headers = 0) throw(Error);
00105     string get_temp_file(FILE *&stream) throw(InternalErr);
00106     HTTPResponse *plain_fetch_url(const string &url) 
00107     throw(Error, InternalErr);
00108     HTTPResponse *caching_fetch_url(const string &url) 
00109     throw(Error, InternalErr);
00110 
00111     bool url_uses_proxy_for(const string &url) throw();
00112     bool url_uses_no_proxy_for(const string &url) throw();
00113 
00114     void extract_auth_info(string &url);
00115 
00116     bool cond_fetch_url(const string &url, const vector<string> &headers);
00117 
00118     friend size_t save_raw_http_header(void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nmemb, 
00119                        void *http_connect);
00120     friend class HTTPConnectTest;
00121     friend class ParseHeader;
00122 
00123 protected:
00129     HTTPConnect() { }
00130     HTTPConnect(const HTTPConnect &copy_from) { }
00131     HTTPConnect &operator=(const HTTPConnect &rhs) { 
00132     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "Unimplemented assignment");
00133     }
00135 
00136 public:
00137     HTTPConnect(RCReader *rcr) throw(Error, InternalErr);
00138 
00139     virtual ~HTTPConnect();
00140 
00141     void set_credentials(const string &u, const string &p) throw(InternalErr);
00142     void set_accept_deflate(bool defalte);
00143 
00149     void set_cache_enabled(bool enabled) { 
00150     if (d_http_cache)
00151         d_http_cache->set_cache_enabled(enabled);
00152     }
00153 
00155     bool is_cache_enabled() { 
00156     return (d_http_cache) ? d_http_cache->is_cache_enabled() : false; 
00157     }
00158 
00159     HTTPResponse *fetch_url(const string &url) throw(Error, InternalErr);
00160 };

00166 // way of running the tests under valgrind.

00168 // Revision 1.9.2.7  2004/01/17 13:37:50  rmorris

00170 // reference between MS VC++ 6.0 and MS VC++ 7.0.

00172 // Revision 1.9.2.6  2003/09/30 16:36:38  jimg
00173 // I removed some old code and fixed a typo where ParseHeaders was declared
00174 // as a struct here and a class in the .cc file.
00175 //
00176 // Revision 1.9.2.5 2003/09/30 16:29:45 jimg Fixed bug #670. As a result of
00177 // fixing the bug where DODS_CONF was ignored, I changed the way the HTTP
00178 // cache was used. HTTPConnect was always initializing the cache, so it was
00179 // OK to assume that the d_http_cache member was a valid pointer. One result
00180 // of fixing the DODS_CONF bug was that the HTTPCache instance was not always
00181 // initialized. The server helper programs asciival and www_int assume that
00182 // they must disable the cache, so they call Connect::set_cacne_enable(false)
00183 // which then calls the matching method here. I added a test so that
00184 // d_http_cache is only used if it's non-null.
00185 //
00186 // Revision 1.9.2.4  2003/06/23 11:49:18  rmorris
00187 // The #pragma interface directive to GCC makes the dynamic typing
00188 // functionality go completely haywire under OS X on the PowerPC. We can't
00189 // use that directive on that platform and it was ifdef'd out for that case.
00190 //
00191 // Revision 1.9.2.3  2003/06/14 21:59:04  rmorris
00192 // Change to some interim code (in transition) in regards to parseHeaders
00193 // defined as both class and struct - to get it to compile under win32.
00194 // UNIX compiler allows, VC++ does not.
00195 //
00196 // Revision 1.9.2.2  2003/05/06 06:44:15  jimg
00197 // Modified HTTPConnect so that the response headers are no longer a class
00198 // member. This cleans up the class interface and paves the way for using
00199 // the multi interface of libcurl. That'll have to wait for another day...
00200 //

00214 // Revision 1.6  2003/02/27 23:36:10  jimg

00217 // Revision 1.5  2003/02/27 18:21:48  jimg
00218 // I removed old code (code inside #if 0 ... #endif) and changed the private
00219 // definitions of HTTPConnect(), ... to protected definitions. These methods
00220 // are present to prevent C++ defaults from being called. I made them
00221 // protected so that specializations of this class can hide their own
00222 // empty constructor, et cetera. When these are private a subclass cannot do
00223 // that.

00251 // Revision 1.1.2.6  2002/09/14 03:40:54  jimg
00252 // Added get_response_headers() method. This method provides a way to access
00253 // the headers included in a response, specifically so that they can be
00254 // cached. Added is_response_present() which returns true when fetch_url()
00255 // has been called and a response is present. Also added tests which cause
00256 // the four methods that access information from the response (output, et c.)
00257 // to throw an InternalErr if they are called and is_response_present() would
00258 // return false.
00259 //
00260 // Revision 1.1.2.5  2002/08/06 22:08:56  jimg
00261 // Added a string (d_upstring) so that password information can be passed to
00262 // libcurl using something that's persistent for the duration of the
00263 // `connection' without using local static storage in the set_credentials
00264 // method (which causes problems with MT-safety).
00265 //
00266 // Revision 1.1.2.4  2002/07/06 20:19:01  jimg
00267 // Added two methods that make twiddling the proxy stuff on the fly easier.
00268 // These look at a specific URL to help decide if the current proxy
00269 // configuration should be changed for *this particular* url. I've also removed
00270 // a number of methods that didn't belong here.
00271 //
